assignment.title: Internetworking Things
assignment.abstract: As a simple and easy way to interconnect things, we build sample applications with Node-RED. Node-RED is an open source browser-based tool for wiring together hardware devices, APIs and online services in new and interesting ways.

assignment.title: Internet/Web Basics
assignment.abstract: Establishing HTTP connections and sending different kinds of HTTP requests. Getting to know libraries to use for these purposes, HTTP content negotiation and other HTTP headers. Parsing and displaying simple content in a smartphone application.

assignment.title: Project Proposals
assignment.abstract: Develop and formulate an individual project idea for the lab lightening talks.

assignment.title: Project Development
assignment.abstract: Project group formation and development of a more concrete description of the project. This includes a detailed list of sources for input data, targets for outputs, how this data maps to activities, and what the detailed meaning of the data is with respect to the project idea.

assignment.title: Activity Vocabulary Development
assignment.abstract: ASbase is using Activity Streams as its data model. This assignment is about developing a vocabulary that is sufficient to represent the data that is required to make the project work. The vocabulary that is used for conveying activities that are relevant to the scenario should be formalized in this step. Also, examples for concrete activities that are exchanged during the scenario should be given.

assignment.title: Getting Data into ASbase
assignment.abstract: Based on the vocabulary, in this assignment data sources (either APIs or networked things) are used to get information, convert it into Activity Streams, and then submit it to ASbase to that it can be used by ASbase consumers.

assignment.title: Getting Data out of ASbase
assignment.abstract: In this assignment, activity streams that are distributed by the platform should be consumed by ASbase clients. These can for instance be analysis modules or user interfaces/dashboards.

assignment.title: Mixing Groups: Scenario Mashups
assignment.abstract: Coordinate with others group with the goal of making use of their information within your own scenario. This step will involve negotiating how to use and align the (perhaps differing) vocabularies.

assignment.title: Planning and Building the Mashup
assignment.abstract: Implement a mashup that is based on data from your own sources and from at least one other group, with the ASbase platform as the central coordinator.
